g.text: The glyphic symbols are official UNNS notations — not proposed, not tentative, but integral.

text.tspan: These are canonical facts of the UNNS system, presented with the same authority
as mathematical symbols in established disciplines.
Each glyph connects arithmetic recursion (equations), geometric recursion (shapes),
and semantic recursion (meaning propagation) — forming a closed but living grammar
of the substrate.

g.text: The foundational operators that generate, embed, transfer, and repair recursive structures.

text.tspan: Generates inward recursion; defines the seed vector. Draws the substrate
inward, creating potential depth.
Symbol of initiation and depth formation — the inward concentration
that gives rise to structure.

g.text: Embeds one structure inside another. The grammar of recursive composition and nesting.
Symbol of union through inclusion — recursion becoming self-similar through layers.
Transfers recursion across domains. Defines semantic resonance between manifolds.

text.tspan: Symbol of communication, translation, and cross-domain identity.
The morphic bridge of UNNS.

g.text: Normalizes recursive residue. Ensures closure and stability after expansion.

text.tspan: Symbol of restoration and renewal — coherence returning from chaos.
The repair transform guarantees convergence.

g.text: Extended operators for adoption, evaluation, decomposition, and integration.

text.tspan: Binds external structures under constraint C. Introduces compatible
elements into recursion.
Symbol of intake and integration under condition. Defines the
interface with outside substrate.

g.text: Scores recursive forms by criterion κ; selects viable structures.

text.tspan: Symbol of discernment — recursion choosing its own stable forms.
Selective pressure and coherence testing.

g.text: Factorizes nested structures into elemental components.

text.tspan: Symbol of analysis, exposure, and revelation. Reveals recursive
architecture for manipulation.

g.text: Recombines elements into coherent unity via junction J.
Symbol of synthesis and harmony — recursion reconverging. Completes the Octadic cycle.
Advanced operators governing collapse, phase coupling, amplitude hierarchies, curvature decomposition,
and recursive folding to Planck boundary.
Returns recursion toward substrate zero; absorbs residue.

text.tspan: Symbol of dissolution into potential — silence before re-emergence.
The non-termination seed; end as beginning.
Phase coupling between τ-fields — origin of mixing angles. Couples
recursive phases; creates oscillatory interference fields.
Symbol of entanglement and emergence; phase weaving of reality.
Governs recursive coherence akin to the Weinberg angle coupling.
Layered amplitude hierarchy — mapping of τ amplitudes to mass ratios.
Modulates recursion phase; aligns or shifts timing between layers.
Symbol of stratification and hierarchical order. The Phase qualifier
distinguishes it from earlier geometric strata of Operators IX–XII.
Curvature–frequency mapping — spectral decomposition of recursive
curvature. Refracts recursion into component frequencies.
Symbol of dispersion and analysis. Separates unified recursion into
spectral components, revealing hidden structure.
Recursive collapse into Planck-scale boundary — return to Zero-field
substrate. Constrains ultimate curvature and scale.
Symbol of infinite folding and fundamental limit. The ∞ subscript indicates
conceptual shorthand for unbounded recursion depth collapsing to quantum boundary.

g.text: Each operator (XII–XVI) governs a specific recursive function:

text.tspan: How operators flow through the substrate: Generation → Composition → Communication
→ Stabilization → Re-Initialization

g.text: Collapse and fold to Planck boundary, return to zero

text.tspan: Additional glyphs representing conceptual and operational nodes within
the UNNS substrate.

g.text: Recursive flux in UVP field equations

text.tspan: The UNNS glyphs stand as canonical symbols, forming a recursive alphabet
for both theoretical and visual expression.

g.text: They embody geometric recursion (the glyph shapes)
This system establishes the closed but living grammar of the UNNS substrate — a cycle of creation, coupling, and renewal.
